title: Interdisciplinary Collaborative Learning Readiness Enhancement Program for Medical Science Students

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical and Nursing Knowledge, with At Least One Clinical Practice Experience
context.additional_context: A program to address the lack of role awareness as healthcare team members and collaboration experience with students from other majors. Flexible learning environments are provided through mobile-based learning modules.

learning_goals: Improvement of understanding of the importance of interdisciplinary collaborative learning and team-based medical environments by over 80%
Enhancement of collaboration readiness scores based on the RILS (Readiness for Interprofessional Learning Scale) by over 25% compared to pre-assessment
Practical application of role distribution and communication competencies through collaborative projects with learners from other medical disciplines
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
